intro: Otites wolgensis, commonly known as the Wolgen's otite, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and yellow. Otites wolgensis is adapted to cold climates and is often found growing in rocky or alpine environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
